diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Medullary thyroid carcinoma, metastatic to cervical lymph nodes and the liver.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Papillary thyroid carcinoma, follicular thyroid carcinoma, poorly differentiated thyroid cancer, anaplastic thyroid cancer, primary thyroid lymphoma, metastatic tumors, reactive or lymphoproliferative disorders.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on imaging studies showing hypoechoic nodules with microcalcifications and enlarged lymph nodes suggestive of metastases. Fine-needle aspiration biopsy revealed cells highly suspicious for papillary carcinoma, but histopathological analysis ultimately confirmed medullary thyroid carcinoma with metastatic involvement of lymph nodes and liver.
